elements.title: Aleksandra Waliszewska (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that gothic painter Aleksandra Waliszewska (artwork pictured) works with The Vampire's Wife?

elements.title: consecutive seasons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Seattle SuperSonics had consecutive seasons with identical records under different head coaches?

elements.title: Alison Frantz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alison Frantz's photographs played a crucial role in the decipherment of Linear B?

elements.title: Guadalupe cypress (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that saving the Guadalupe cypress included the help of 40 Judas goats?

elements.title: Dorkas Tokoro-Hanasbey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dorkas Tokoro-Hanasbey, the only female member of the New Guinea Council, arrived thirty minutes late to her inauguration ceremony?

elements.title: New York City public toilet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2006, half a million people used a temporary New York City public toilet sponsored by a toilet paper brand?

elements.title: Johan Herman Schützercrantz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Swedish naval officer Johan Herman Schützercrantz fought in the American Revolutionary War and participated in the Battle of the Chesapeake?

elements.title: an exhibition hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an exhibition hall for the 1939 New York World's Fair later hosted athletic events at a historically Black university in Virginia?

elements.title: fork-tailed drongo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the fork-tailed drongo gives genuine alarm calls but will sometimes lie to steal food from other animals?
